publication.abstract: Mixed model-based approaches to genome-wide association studies (GWAS) of binary traits in related individuals can account for non-genetic risk factors in an integrated manner. However, they are technically challenging. GLOGS (Genome-wide LOGistic mixed model/Score test) addresses such challenges with efficient statistical procedures and a parallel implementation. GLOGS has high power relative to alternative approaches as risk covariate effects increase, and can complete a GWAS in minutes. Â© The Author 2012. Published by Oxford University Press. publication.title: GLOGS: A fast and powerful method for GWAS of binary traits with risk covariates in related populations

summary.description: A method for using covariates to improve power in GWAS with related individuals
